chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J. Hackler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant will not request early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Domestic violence counseling
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with victim.

timeConds.notes:
to commence on or before 7-25-2022 with work release privileges. 

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.

2:59 PM Defendant Adam J. Hackler appeared in court, Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger appeared in court for Adam J. Hackler. Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.

Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 1/24/2021 - NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM.  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.*

DEFENDANT TO POST 1,000 CASH (already posted)
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.    Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.G. OR RESIDENCE.    If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
